description.en: This course overviews: a) theory and mechanisms of film formation, b) types of modern aqueous film and nano-coatings, c) different types of coating processes, d) common types of coatings for tablets and multiparticulates, e) coating process control and measuring systems, f) coating defects and limitations, g) coating PAT and PIT issues, h) film and nano-coating materials (polymers, plasticizers, colourants and solvents), i) compression coating principles, j) controlled release coatings, i) free films and final product characterization of coated dosage forms.
description.et:
Käesolev kursus annab ülevaate:
a)õhukese polümeerkatte moodustumise teooriast ja mehhanismidest, b)tänapäevastest vesikeskkonnas toodetavatest õhukestest polümeerkatetest ja nanokatetest,c) erinevatest katmisprotsessidest, d)tablettide ja mitmeosaliste ravimvormide puhul kasutatavate katete põhitüüpidest, e) katmisprotsessi kontrolli ja monitoorimise süsteemidest, f) katete defektidest ja katmisprotsessi rakendamist piiravatest teguritest, g) katmisprotsessi PAT-ist ja PIT-ist, h) õhukeste polümeerkatete ja nanokatete valmistamisel kasutatavatest materjalidest (polümeerid, plastifikaatorid, värvained ja lahustid), i)pressimisel valmistatavate katetega katmise põhimõtetest, j) raviane kontrollitud vabanemist võimaldavatest katetest, k) õhukeste polümeerkilede ja kaetud ravimvormide lõpp-produktide iseloomustamisest ja analüüsist.

objectives.en: The objective of the present course is to provide an advanced level knowledge on pharmaceutical coating technologies (including sugar, film, compressed and modern thin/nano coating technologies). More specifically, the course will cover layering and film formation mechanisms, testing of film properties, materials selection, coating process control and measuring systems, film coating PAT/PIT, scale-up issues, nano coating technologies, controlled release coating applications and final product characterization.
objectives.et: Käesoleva kursuse eesmärgiks on tagada kursusel osalejatele kõrgtasemelised teadmised farmaatsias kasutatavate katmistehnoloogiate (suhkrukate, õhuke polümeerkate, pressimisel saadav kate kui ka õhuke/nano kihiline kate) kohta. Kursus käsitleb õhukese polümeerkatete ja kihtide moodustumise mehhanisme, õhukese polümeerkatte omaduste testimist,katmiseks kasutatavate materjalide valikut, katmisprotsessi kontrolli ja katete mõõtmise meetodeid, õhukeste polümeerkatete PAT-i ja PIT-i, katmisprotsesside mahu suurendamisega kaasnevaid probleeme, nanokatmise tehnoloogiaid, katmistehnolooogia rakendamist raviainet kontrollitult vabastavate preparaatide disainimiseks ja valmistoote iseloomustamist.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course:
- knows history and background of pharmaceutical coatings
- knows theory of pharmaceutical film formation
- knows basic methods and techniques in solvent-mediated coating (including thin and nanocoatings)
learning_outcomes.et: - lahustitel põhinevaid katmise põhimeetodeid ja tehnikaid (kaasa arvatud õhukese/nano kihiliste katete moodustamise tehnoloogiad)

learning_outcomes.en: - knows basic methods for pharmaceutical compressed coating
- knows the commonly used sugar/film/compressed coating  materials and their properties
learning_outcomes.et: - suhkru/õhukestes polümeer-/pressitud katetes kasutatavaid abiaineid ja nende omadusi

learning_outcomes.en: - has basic knowledege on coating process including key process parameters and process monitoring/control principles
learning_outcomes.et: - baastasemel katmisprotsessi, kaasa arvatud katmisprotsessi põhiparameetreid ja protsessi monitoorimise ja kontrolli põhimõteid

learning_outcomes.en: - understand the significance of PAT/PIT in pharmaceutical coating

notes.et: In this elective course the student will gain knowledge on modern aqueous film and nano-coatings, theory of film formation, types of coating processes, common types of coatings for tablets and multiparticulates, coating process control and measuring systems, coating PAT and PIT issues, film and nano-coating materials (polymers, plasticizers, colourants and solvents), compression coatings, free films and final product characterization of coated dosage forms.

grade_evaluation.et:
Written final examination and seminar presentation.
There is a written examination in the end of the course.

A - Excellent (91-100%):	The student shows an excellent knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers are exceptionally well and precisely compiled, logically presented, and correct. The language is also perfect.   

B - Very good (81-90%):	The student shows very good knowledge on the course 
topic area and substance. The anwers are well written  and mainly correct. The language is also good without any significant flaws.   
 
C - Good (71-80%): 	The student shows a good knowledge on the course  topic area and substance. The anwers are quite well compiled and mainly correct. The language is also quite good with only some flaws.   

D - Satisfactory (61-70%):	The student shows satisfactory knowledge on the  course topic area and substance. The anwers contain  some siginificant deficiences and flaws. The language is only fair to passable with clear mistakes.   

E - Passable (51-60%): 	The student shows only a fair and passable knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers contain many deficiences. The language is quite poor with numerous flaws.   


F - Rejected (0-50%): 	The student shows very poor knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers contain numerous significant flaws and deficiences. The language is very poor with numerous flaws.

description.et:
Opening remarks. Historical perspectives. Pharmaceutical applications of coatings. Film coating vs. sugar coating . Film coating materials.
Delivery of seminar topics and materials.
Theory and mechanisms of film formation onto the tablet surfaces. Latex and pseudolatex coating solutions. Surface effects in film coating (wetting, penetration, spreading, adhesion).
Chemistry and applications of conventional immediate-release film coating materials. Plasticizers, colorants and solvents. Film coating formulae examples.
Chemistry and applications of modified-release film coating materials. Prolonged-release coatings. Enteric and colon-site specific coatings. Film coating formulae examples.
Pharmaceutical coating processes, coating variables and scale-up. Process development and PAT. Automation of coating processes. Solvent-mediated PITs
Characterisation of film properties. Free films. Mechanical properties of polymeric films. Moisture and oxygen permeability. Coating defects in aqueous film-coated tablets.
Alternative coating processes. Solvent-free coating of pharmaceutical solids. Compressed coating of tablets.
Pharmaceutical thin-coating technology. Particle surface modification. Layer-by-layer technology. Other nano-coating techniques.
